content.description:
Statue of Queen Njinga Created Circa 2000 on Public Display in Angola, West Africa

Queen Njinga stands upright with a stern facial expression.
Queen Njinga wears a crown, highly decorated clothing, and elaborate jewelry.
Queen Njinga holds an axe in her right hand.
mtcurado/Getty Images
content.question: Which of the following statements best contextualizes the historical origins of the statue?

choices.label: Women played many key roles in West and Central African societies, including serving as spiritual leaders, teachers, market traders, political advisors, and farmers.
The adoption of Islam by leaders often resulted in their subjects blending aspects of these introduced faiths with Indigenous spiritual beliefs.
The Indian Ocean supported the emergence of early societies and fostered early global connections beyond the African continent.
Technological and agricultural innovations contributed to population growth in West and Central Africa.

content.answer: Women played many key roles in West and Central African societies, including serving as spiritual leaders, teachers, market traders, political advisors, and farmers.
